doc.previous: In February 2011, Boeing received a contract for 179 KC-46 U.S. Air Force tankers at a value of $35Â billion.[54] The KC-46 tankers are based on the KC-767.
doc.after: Boeing jointly with Science Applications International Corporation (SAIC), were the prime contractors in the U.S. military's Future Combat Systems program.[55] The FCS program was canceled in June 2009 with all remaining systems swept into the BCT Modernization program.[56] Boeing works jointly with SAIC in the BCT Modernization program like the FCS program but the U.S. Army will play a greater role in creating baseline vehicles and will only contract others for accessories.
